questions.question: Which of the following is not an atomic proposition?

answers.b: I take a taxi if I have enough money
answers.d: There was no water in the jug on the table in the kitchen

explanations.a: This is an atomic proposition; it cannot be broken into simpler propositions.
explanations.b: This sentence combines 2 atomic propositions: 'I take a taxi' and 'I have enough money'.
explanations.c: This is an atomic proposition; it cannot be broken into simpler propositions.
explanations.d: This is an atomic proposition; it cannot be broken into simpler propositions.

questions.question: If the weather is warm and the sky is clear, then we go boating. Pick the valid conclusion. [Hint: try to think of each proposition as a symbol]

answers.a: We did not go boating, so the weather must not have been warm
answers.b: The sky was cloudy and the weather was warm, so we did not go boating.
answers.c: We went boating, so the weather must have been warm and the sky clear
answers.d: The sky was clear and the weather was warm. We did not go boating

explanations.a: It is possible that the weather was warm but the sky was cloudy
explanations.b: You can go boating when the sky is clear and weather is warm, but that does not mean you cannot go boating when they are not.
explanations.c: You can go boating when the sky is clear and weather is warm, but that does not mean you cannot go boating when they are not.
explanations.d: If both requirements are fulfilled, then you must go out.
